Key Arguments: The legislation sets a dangerous precedent similar to censorship in dictatorships.
It could allow the government to cover up lies and censor dissenting voices.
Past government actions during the COVID-19 pandemic demonstrate potential overreach and misuse of such powers.
The government cannot be trusted as the sole arbiter of truth.
Free speech is essential for a free society, and individuals are capable of discerning misinformation themselves.
Main Themes: Historical and contemporary examples of government misinformation
COVID-19 pandemic management as a case study of government overreach
Notable Quotes: Censorship of information or communications determined to be Misinformation or Disinformation is a dangerous precedent only used in dictatorships or tyrannical regimes.
God forbid if we allow the government to legislate themselves as the sole arbiters of truth and to censor anything they deem as untruthful.
As educated Australians we do not need a government to tell us or protect us from, what they deem as misinformation as we are capable of discerning that for ourselves.
